title: If one chants Hare Krishna with offenses, is he risking going to hell? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. obviously! This is like elephant going for bathing and after bathing he will come and shower mud on him; than what is the use of bathing? Better don't bath only. Of all sinful activities, an offense to a pure devotee, or Vaiṣṇava, is the most severe. An offense at the lotus feet of a Vaiṣṇava is so disastrous that Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu has compared it to a mad elephant that enters a garden and causes great havoc by uprooting many plants and trees. If one is an offender at the lotus feet of a brāhmaṇa or Vaiṣṇava, his offenses uproot all his auspicious activities. One should therefore very carefully guard against committing vaiṣṇava-aparādha, or offenses at the lotus feet of a Vaiṣṇava. - (Srimad Bhagavat - 7.4.28) Therefore, chanting harekrsna and commits offences it's like making our life more hellish way. Better you don't chant and keep committing offences and it will actually make your life hellish. why to chant hare krsna and make offenses? this can be anyway done by not chanting. If you chant, chant in such a way that you will feel Krishna is dancing on your tongue. And, best remedy is to chant the holy name of Sri Krsna in the association of devotees and develop the taste to chant the holy name. In meanwhile, you will get taste for chanting and you will not commit offences. And even though if you commit offences(indirectly) you can ask forgiveness and try to do attonement for that offences you had committed. So, try not to commit offences and try always being connected to the holy name and Devotees, because the devotees and holy name is the only saviour to make our life perfect.  Hope you got your answer!☺ Thank you very much Hare Krishna

ISKCON leaders will try to silence you. But if you are speaking truth and pointing to the hypocrisy of the leaders and Gurus, it is not a blasphemy. Rather the Vedas encourage you to use your brain to filter out the bogus Gurus and leaders in ISKCON. If you are not comfortable with all that Prabhupada says in his books , you should doubt it. The brain that God has given you should be used. Use logic and argument to challenge all that you find nonsense. Be rest assured that using logic and being honest to filter out the nonsense is not blasphemy. No harm will come to you. So do not be scared :)
No, though it is not the best method. Chanted with any emotion, feeling or bhav, God's name will ultimately take you to God…bhagvat 7.1.25–30, 7.10.40.
Chanting Hare Krishna with or without offenses is always auspicious and won't lead one to hell. Chant as much sincerely as possible, rest Sree Krishna will take care. Hare Krishna :)
